intro: Moraea intermedia, commonly known as the common moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of flowers on slender stems. Its leaves are grass-like, narrow, and arranged in a basal rosette. Moraea intermedia thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
